title.narrative: Developing a Research Agenda on Successful Transitions of Africa's Youth into the Labour Market
Élaboration d'un programme de recherche sur les transitions réussies des jeunes Africains sur le marché du travail

description.narrative:
Youth employment is one of the most urgent challenges confronting Africa today, and is gaining prominence as a top priority for policymakers, practitioners, and donor agencies. This project will provide funding for a workshop designed to shape a research agenda to promote interventions for expanding economic opportunities for disadvantaged youth in Africa.
More jobs for African youth IDRC's Supporting Inclusive Growth program is exploring a research program focused on providing evidence to inform policies and interventions that will create more jobs for youth in Africa. The work will be country-specific, while leaving room for cross-country comparative research on issues that have wider applications across countries.
Insights and expertise This consultative workshop will bring together leading regional and international experts to help shape the research agenda. The goal? To develop a program that can -respond to needs -build upon existing efforts with no duplication -capitalize on building blocks to maximize its impact -identify potential research themes and partners
The University of Cape Town and the Zambia Institute for Policy Analysis and Research will co-organize the workshop to take place in Lusaka, Zambia, in December 2014.
